thread.title: No One Can Stop Laughing At Dedication To Figuring Out Trump’s Fear Of Stairs
thread.title_full: No One Can Stop Laughing At Dedication To Figuring Out Trump’s Fear Of Stairs

author: John Haltiwanger
title: No One Can Stop Laughing At Dedication To Figuring Out Trump’s Fear Of Stairs
text:
Like Us On Facebook Like Us On Facebook 
On Wednesday morning, CNN discussed what is clearly an extremely vital issue we should all dedicate far more time to: Is Donald Trump afraid of stairs? 
Obviously, this is far more important than the fact that the FBI is investigating whether or not Trump’s campaign colluded with Russia to influence the 2016 election, or the fact that the GOP healthcare plan he’s promoting could rob millions of people of their health insurance. Comey confirms FBI's investigating alleged Russian interference To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video America is basically a massive dumpster fire right now, but screw it, let’s talk about Donald Trump versus stairs. CNN is asking the important questions this morning pic.twitter.com/a5flXuvaTn 
— Oliver Darcy (@oliverdarcy) March 22, 2017 This is why we can’t have nice things. 
— Alden Peters (@aldenpeters) March 22, 2017 CNN chyron: IS THE PRESIDENT AFRAID OF STAIRS? 
— Ned Resnikoff (@resnikoff) March 22, 2017 
Is Trump afraid of stairs? 
Who really knows? 
Who really cares? Well, CNN does, apparently. 
For those who are curious as to why this is even a discussion, it’s all because of a conspiracy theory that says the president held the hand of British Prime Minister Theresa May when she visited the White House because of his alleged stairs phobia. 
But there’s no concrete evidence the president is afraid of stairs — much like there’s no actual evidence Obama ever wiretapped Trump. PM Thersea May holds President Trump's hand outside White House To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
May recently addressed these rumors in an interview with Vogue . 
She said, 
I think he was actually being a gentleman. 
We were about to walk down a ramp, and he said it might be a bit awkward. 
The real news here is that a woman actually called Trump a gentleman. Sounds like alternative facts, if you ask me. To be fair, stairs can definitely be dangerous. I wish my son were afraid of stairs. pic.twitter.com/3shd6Dqq2e 
— Charles C. W. Cooke (@charlescwcooke) March 22, 2017 But this is exactly why people don’t like the media right now. "Why do people hate the media?" 
CNN: "Allow me to demonstrate." pic.twitter.com/fxbznXUgOx 
— Seth Mandel (@SethAMandel) March 22, 2017 Uhhhh. @CNN is talking about how Trump may have a fear of stairs…? Are you joking me…? And people wonder why the media gets tuned out 
— Brown Sugah (@SexyRexy8Lover) March 22, 2017 If @CNN wants to stop being called "fake news" by the Trump Admin, they should probably go with real news stories..not Trump v Stairs‍♀️ 
— Caroline Craig (@CeeJayCraig) March 22, 2017 
There are so many things we could discuss about Trump, and many valid things to criticize about him — things that have nothing to do with stairs. 
Maybe he’s afraid of stairs, but his apparent fear of Muslims , refugees and people of color is way more concerning.
